questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'acquiescent'?
questions.explanation: Acquiescent means ready to accept without protest; 'resistant' means actively opposing.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'diffident'?
questions.explanation: Diffident means shy and lacking self-confidence; 'assertive' means confidently self-assured.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'abnegate'?
questions.explanation: Abnegate means to renounce or deny oneself; 'embrace' means to willingly accept or adopt.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'apogee'?
questions.explanation: Apogee is the highest point; 'nadir' is the lowest point.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'apathy'?
questions.explanation: Apathy means lack of feeling or interest; 'enthusiasm' is intense interest or excitement.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'pellucid'?
questions.explanation: Pellucid means extremely clear; 'opaque' means not transparent, visually or conceptually.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'cacophonous'?
questions.explanation: Cacophonous describes harsh, jarring sounds; 'euphonious' means pleasing to the ear.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'pusillanimous'?
questions.explanation: Pusillanimous means cowardly; 'courageous' directly opposes that trait.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'execrable'?
questions.explanation: Execrable means extremely bad or detestable; 'laudable' means deserving praise.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'phlegmatic'?
questions.explanation: Phlegmatic means calm and unemotional; 'excitable' means easily stirred emotionally.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'abstruse'?
questions.explanation: Abstruse means difficult to understand; 'lucid' means clear and easy to understand.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'sardonic'?
questions.explanation: Sardonic means bitterly mocking or cynical; 'sincere' suggests genuine, not mocking.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'implacable'?
questions.explanation: Implacable means unable to be calmed or appeased; 'placable' means easily calmed or pacified.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'penurious'?
questions.explanation: Penurious means extremely poor; 'affluent' means very wealthy.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'esoteric'?
questions.explanation: Esoteric means intended for a small, specialized group; 'exoteric' means suitable for the general public.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'ignominious'?
questions.explanation: Ignominious means shameful or disgraceful; 'honorable' is the moral opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'recalcitrant'?
questions.explanation: Recalcitrant means stubbornly disobedient; 'compliant' means inclined to agree or obey.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'turgid' (as in writing style)?
questions.explanation: Turgid prose is swollen, overly ornate; 'limpid' describes clear, simple writing.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'abeyance'?
questions.explanation: Abeyance is a state of temporary inactivity; 'continuance' suggests ongoing activity.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'jejune' when applied to ideas?
questions.explanation: Jejune ideas are naive or superficial; 'insightful' ideas show depth and understanding.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'mendacious'?
questions.explanation: Mendacious means lying or dishonest; 'veracious' means truthful and accurate.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'abject' (as in abject apology)?
questions.explanation: An abject apology is overly humble or self-humiliating; 'proud' suggests the opposite attitude.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'supine' (figuratively, as in attitude)?
questions.explanation: Supine in this sense means passive or failing to act; 'assertive' means actively standing up for oneself.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'threnody'?
questions.explanation: Threnody is a song of mourning; 'paean' is a song of praise or triumph.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'tractable'?
questions.explanation: Tractable means easily managed; 'refractory' means stubbornly resistant to control.
